Reviews.Content: Very Good Hotel, But Will Consider Another Establishment For Next Visit I would agree with most of the reviews for the property; the majority of the service staff were exceptionally professional and helpful. I must note, however, that my experience with some of the front desk staff was not positive. On several different occasions, the front desk service were quite rude in their response to my requests. In one instance, I requested a recommendation for a high-end restaurant that served shabu-shabu that was not touristy. Initially, I was directed to a sushi/sashimi restaurant. When I insisted on shabu-shabu, I was given a brochure for a restaurant that looks more like a bad cross between Disneyland and Benihana than a proper dining facility. They insisted that this was the ONLY shabu-shabu restaurant of which they were familiar. Come on! In all of Tokyo??? I ended up not taking any of their recommendations for the rest of my stay. The facilities of the hotel were very good. However, I would rate the polish, fit, finish, and amenities a notch lower than Raffles Hotels that I have visited in Asia. I likely will consider the Park Hyatt, the Ritz Carlton, or another establishment on my next visit to Tokyo.
Reviews.Author: Lemuel-T

Reviews.Content: Nirvana in hotels This is a wonderful, elegant hotel, with a proud, efficient staff that goes out of their way to ensure your stay is exceptional. The rooms are lovely and calming--quiet with wonderful, large marble bathrooms. Dining room for breakfast is elegant and refined. This is a gem of an oasis in a large urban throng. It embodies understated elegance. Tones of beige and white marble throughout. Personal service--doorman greets you by name.
Reviews.Author: Luisa36

Reviews.Content: Elegant, Efficient, Perfectly Good A great location and extraordinary service highlight this Ginza jewel, where modern, Western rooms compete with Japanese service de luxe. Expensive, but worth it. Room service was so-so, and the rooms are relatively small compared to the spacious bathrooms. I will stay at the Park Hyatt next time around, but would recommend the Seiyo Ginza for business travelers and first-timers to Tokyo. Reminds me of a 1990's New York hotel. Fancy in older ways: mirrors and closets and fixtures.
Reviews.Author: Dangank

Reviews.Content: Boring If you are looking for a room in the fancy shopping district of Ginza, then this is perhaps your hotel, but who really wants to shop in Tokyo? Except for rooms that are worn (and in urgent need of redecoration) and have no view (as the hotel is in a low-rise and surrounded by taller buildings), and overpriced restaurants the hotel has no facilities to speak off: no pool, no spa etc. No views from the restaurants either as they have no windows. Thus we found this hotel a bit sinister and fled to the amazing Ritz Carlton Tokyo.The only plus is that the hotel offers acceptable prices on it webpage and the webpage of lhw, although given the absence of facilities, the price is no such value for money. My guess is that the hotel is struggling to fill its rooms, and that may well be the reason for the price offers.
Reviews.Author: AlainDV

Reviews.Content: Love Love LOVE The Hotel Seiyo Ginza!!! OK where do I even begin. There are so many lovely, wonderful things about this hotel.First, the overall style: if you're looking for high-tech modern skyscrapers like the Park Hyatt, this hotel isn't for you. If you prefer a smaller hotel, with a classic, understated, quiet elegance, where you can relax and leave your stress behind, then don't stay anywhere else.The staff here is wonderful. They are exceptionally courteous, helpful, and welcoming without being the least bit intrusive. If it rains, they have dozens of umbrellas at the door in case you should need one; if you don't speak Japanese and are going somewhere, they will write every detail down for you and make sure you know exactly how to get back to the hotel; if you need a taxi at 5am, no problem. Other hotel staff around the world should come here for lessons!The rooms are very comfortable and so thoughtfully laid out. Every detail was considered, such as a dimmer switch for the bathroom light, buttons next to the bed that allow you to open  close the curtains without having to get up, high-speed internet access in the rooms (there is an extra charge for this),an unusually large marble bathroom with a deep soaking tub and a separate glass enclosed shower; in the dressing area, there's also a built-in vanity where you can dry your hair, put on makeup, etc. They provide robes, slippers, pajamas, an in-room safe, a very good hair dryer (not the wall kind), and wonderful soaps. You feel at home here immediately.The location is great - right in Ginza, near fantastic high-end shopping (bring your savings account) and restaurants. It's also only a short walk to the subway. My only disappointment is that I had to leave! I hope I will have the opportunity to stay here again sometime in the future. I loved this hotel and I'll always remember this special place when I think of Tokyo. My thanks to the hotel staff for making my stay so enjoyable.
Reviews.Author: BrysonFan

Reviews.Content: Seiyo Ginza - a beautiful, quiet small hotel in the heart of Ginza. We've stayed a week at this wonderful hotel, and just extended another week. The location is superb, and the service is fantastic. The concierge has helped with a variety of issues, including airplane problems and restaurant reservations, and we've been consistently surprised and happy. Very kid friendly -- just ask our three kids!
Reviews.Author: Toujourtraveling

Reviews.Content: Excellence at it best We were truly impressed by every aspect of this hotel, particular the superb unobtrusive service.The staff made us feel at home and the welcome so warm and personal it felt as if we were special guests in a friend's private chateau. Service was second to none and befitting of the typical Japanese hospitality and charm. We booked through the American Express Platinum Card and got upgraded to a one-bedroom suite with views of Tokyo Tower. The suite was spacious for Japanese standards with an unexpectedly huge marble bathroom. We were truly impressed and made the big mistake of moving to the Park Hyatt Hotel thinking it would be an even nicer treat for the latter portion of our hotel stay, which turned out to be a disasterous move! We have stayed in many hotels in Tokyo and the Hotel Seiyo Ginza is simply the best! Two thumbs up to the wonderful staff!
Reviews.Author: motutoopua

Reviews.Content: Perfect stay at Seiyo We stayed in Seiyo Ginza in January and again in August, 2006. On both occasions, we were delighted with the treatment we received.1. The staff were exceptionally courteous and friendly in all their dealings with us. The rooms were spotless.2. The location in Ginza was very convenient for us - close to restaurants, shopping, Tokyo central train station, etc. 3. Concierge services were exceptional - not only routine things like restaurant reservations (always got us what we asked for). They also picked up tickets for us at the station, phoned ahead to a ryokan to make sure we could get transportation there, etc.4. We made several trips out of Tokyo, and left luggage with the hotel. When we returned, our things were already back in the same room, as we had requested. (This might not always be possible!)We plan to stay there again as soon as we can.
Reviews.Author: Black Lab Nickie

Reviews.Content: Stay Away to think we actually left our beautiful room at the grand hyatt tokyo to come stay here - first of all when you walk in you feel like you can't speak as it is so quiet - then when you get to the room you see a shabby old bygone hotel room - i am a part of the leaders clubs and even with an upgrade the room was really bad - after sitting in the room for 5 minutes we had already called the grand hyatt and went back as soon as we could - we did spend the night here and i was really disapointed that a hotel that was a part of [----]could be so horrible - trust me on this one and stay at the grand hyatt or the four seasons chinzenso (if u want a city retreat) and do NOT stay here
Reviews.Author: lt17

Reviews.Content: wow!!! What a hotel!       The view from our room
Reviews.Author: kellyjames7

Reviews.Content: Wonderul experience I stayed at the Seiyo Ginza Hotel for four nights while I attended a meeting in Tokyo. It was a wonderful experience. The staff was attentive, the room was well appointed, the bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was great with wonderful scented bath items from Australia (soaps, shampoos, bath gels)- and the scents were changed daily. As others have mentioned, this hotel is in a great location for shopping/sightseeing and is very close to the subway (Ginza line). As a woman alone in Tokyo, I felt very safe at this hotel and the areas around it (I went several places by subway on the Ginza line - and never felt uncomfortable).To comment about the food at the hotel (since others have), I did have the opportunity to dine in the hotel's restaurants. The food was very good, although I was not footing the bill (breakfast was typically $20-$35 USD). As with most hotels, the food elsewhere is generally less expensive, and can be just as good, if not better than the hotel. There are so many restaurants of so many varieties close to this hotel that if price is of concern, just go elsewhere. I ate outside of the hotel for both lunches and dinners. There are many Japanese and Western style restaurants within walking distance of the hotel. In fact, my last morning there I went to a Starbucks to save some time - it was next to the subway station - and had breakfast for $5 USD. There are three large department stores right down the street and the basement levels are FULL of the most fabulous foods, pastries, candies etc. I would highly recommend making one of these stores your first stop when you arrive in Tokyo, so that you can have a frame of reference for price and variety of available foods at very reasonable prices. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Tokyo. I can't wait to go back.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Overrated Butler Service During my three days stay, I had never met the butler face to face. When I was checked in, no one explained to me how to contact the butler. I found out later from the desktop manual that the best way to contact th butler is through the faceless telephone!I am also very disappoined by the concierge's recommendations on restaurants. I asked the concierges for recommendations on three different times for a sushi restaurant, a Chinese restaurant, and a noodle shop. I found out later that all the places recommended were all chain stores, and the disappointing fact is that the concierges did not possess a personal knowledge about the restaurants and got the information solely from a big file provided by the management.On a positive note, the bell service of this hotel is the best I ever experienced. The bell captain took the time and gave very detailed instructions to the taxi drivers on how to get to the places that I want to go. When I came back from outside, the bell service personnel always greeted me with a warm and sweet smile. I did feel that I was coming back home.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Superb hotel, best in Tokyo We stayed 4 nights at the Seiyo, which had been recommended to us by a frequent traveller to Japan. We were awed by the level of service. The location is perfect for sightseeing. Ginza is a very pleasant part of Tokyo, there are plenty of beautiful shops and restaurtants; the imperial palace, kabuki theatre and the fish market are within walking distance. So is Tokyo station if you are interested in day trips (Nikko highly recommeded). We have also vistited the Okura, Imperial, Palace and Hyatt. None of these match the understated elegance and impeccable service of the Seiyo.NB: Cannot comment on the restaurants as we did not eat there.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Butique hotel with fabulous service This is my FAVORITE hotel in Tokyo! I stay at Hotel Seiyo Ginza EVERY YEAR for a week. This hotel is located in GINZA and 20 seconds by foot to the best shopping area in Tokyo. The subway entrance is located in front of this hotel. The location is so convenient!! The service is so wonderful! Each room has a BUTLER, who looks after you for 24 hours. Some one wrote a comment about a tenant Kichyo Restaurant. I had to laugh! This restaurant is the one of the most expensive and prestigious restaurant in whole of Japan. It is a GOURMET restaurant!!The main restaurant is in Kyoto and started to operate from Edo period. Kaiseki is a very delicate way of cooking and only special chef can handle it. The way they present each dishes is considered ART. Unfortunately, the person who wrote a negative comment about this restaurant did not only stayed at Hotel Seiyo Ginza but also had very limited experience with Japanese food. You simply cannot compare 3 star restaurant to a simple bistro. Since I had wonderful stay at Seiyo Ginza every time, it is important for me to give RIGHT INFORMATION to others too. By the way, there are so many restaurants around Ginza. Everyone should be able to find right one for your budget. Have a nice stay!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Don't eat at the Restaurant!! I did not stay at this hotel, but I did dine at the Kitscho Restaurant on it's basement level and the experience was so dismal, I felt compelled to log it here on tripadvisor so hopefully others will not suffer the same fate! It is supposed to be a traditional Japanese Kaiseki feast with multiple fancy courses that are one-of-a-kind and amazing. And the price of over $300 USD per person certainly reflects this. HOWEVER, the food is terrible and of very low quality. Even the sushi was stringy and had obviously been previously frozen. We had had fish that very morning at the infamous Tsujiki Fish Market (where you would think this hotel would get their fish!) and it was a thousand times better. Also, the decor had about as much ambiance as a college dorm cafeteria -- cheap chairs and laminate table, brightly lit up; it was ridiculous. This place supposedly has a good reputation, but it seemed to my husband and I that it was just set up as a tourist trap. They didn't even TRY to make it nice. Just scrimped and saved at every corner to try and cheat their guests and make as much money as possible. Not only did we not enjoy ourselves, or the amount of money we paid (which was actually kind of irrelevant cuz we would have hated it even if it was $5 per person!), we were actually deeply offended and angry when we left. We even considered pretending we were sick so we could just walk out but we ended up slogging through because we felt bad for the waitresses. They were actually very good and courteous - as is the case throughout Japan - so we didn't want to make a scene. But part of me could not help but think they fully knew how bad the food was and what a rip-off it was...maybe they felt bad about it too. Anyway, I can not say it more emphatically -- DO NOT SPEND YOUR MONEY HERE!!!
Reviews.Author: UpperWestGal

Reviews.Content: Seiyo Ginza is the epitome of excellence We just returned from a 5 night stay at the Seiyo Ginza. We checked in at 6:00 PM and after unpacking asked the concierge for a dinner suggestion. She suggested a reasonable restaurant across the street and then walked us there and made certain that we were settled before she left. Througout our stay the service was amazing. Our deluxe room was beautiful with one comfortable club chair, desk and chair and a king size bed. The bathroom was huge with a fabulous heated toilet seat. Outside of the bathroom was a dressing room with large closets and a lighted dressing table. Our American Express room rate included a full American breakfast either in the restaurant or in our room. When we left our room we just hit the buttom for our butler who promptly attended to the room. We even had a welcome gift of a plate of beautiful fresh strawberries (very costly in Tokyo). My husband and I loved this hotel and staying in the Ginza area is the most convenient place to be...within a block of the Metro. Wonderful shops are right outside the door and the Kabuki theater is a few blocks away...who could ask for anything more.
Reviews.Author: buzzby

Reviews.Content: "Lexus" of the hotel I just cannot believe that there is no previous review for this hotel. This is the best hotel in Tokyo both in terms of service and in terms of location. You are only a block away from premiere shopping and gourmet district of Ginza. You really get warm care at this rather small size hotel by well experienced people. If you stayed there for three nights, they will never forget you. The view from the room is not that good. However, the room itself is well decorated, equipped with huge bathroom. It is the hotel that makes you want to go back just to stay there. This is Lexus of the hotel -- Japanese service at high quality standard.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
